segments.text: Looking out of the window, the garden seems like a world I’d rather be a part of.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The tranquil scene barely hints at the turmoil happening just inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how the woman stands there, completely oblivious to the rising water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s frustrating to witness the messy reality of the kitchen while she pretends everything is fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children plotting, their playful spirit igniting a rush of memories from my own childhood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the boy stretches for the cookie jar is both daring and reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel disgusted that they’re so sneaky about it, hiding from an adult.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him, so earnest with her open palm, is a picture of naive anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to warn them, to shout about the dangers they don’t see.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But there's a part of me that wants to let them enjoy this little thrill of rebellion.
segments.speaker: PAR
